caption:
This photograph captures a group of young people, predominantly female, engaged in an outdoor activity within a forested area. The composition shows six individuals closely gathered around and focused on a cluster of low, dense bushes, which they are examining or interacting with, possibly picking or studying something within the foliage.

From left to right:
- A person with long, brown hair is leaning forward with intense interest, pointing at something in the bushes.
- A person with lighter brown hair, wearing a green top, is also leaning over the bush, looking closely at what the first individual is pointing at.
- A third individual, facing away from the camera, is dressed in a red cap and a blue jacket; her attention also appears fixed on the same focal point.
- To the right, another young woman with a bandana around her head is gesturing towards the bush, further engaging in whatever the group is examining.
- The fifth individual is bending over the bush, with her head turned towards the first individual, listening or speaking to her.
- The person on the far right stands partially outside the main group, observing the interactions of the others.

All participants are dressed casually and appropriately for an outdoor setting, with elements like jackets, jeans, and caps visible. The setting is a natural, wooded environment with tall pine trees visible in the background, giving an impression of a cool or temperate climate. The overall atmosphere is one of curiosity and collaborative exploration, possibly as part of a nature study or environmental activity. The expressions and body language suggest engagement and enthusiasm among the young people involved.
title: The Balarat Center for Environmental Studies is a part of the Denver Public School system. Classes are conducted here for all grade levels.
